sentence.Network_en: One hallmark of a good politician is his ability to influence people.
sentence.Network_cn: 衡量一个优秀政治家的标志之一就是他影响大众的能力.

sentence.Network_en: Clear expression is the hallmark of good writing.
sentence.Network_cn: 表达清楚是好文章的特点.

sentence.Network_en: His designs show a love of simplicity which is very much his hallmark.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的设计显示出对简约风格的偏爱，这正是他一贯的特点。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (as a noun): from Goldsmiths' Hall in London, where articles were tested and stamped with such a mark

encyclopedia.content: Hallmark (贺曼公司) 在1910年由Joyce Hall 创立，经过百年发展，Hallmark的业务已经多元化，包括贺卡、文具、服装、寝具、化妆品、电子贺卡、电脑软件、数码娱乐、电视频道等，遍布包括中国在内过百国家。

entry.def: The hallmark of something or someone is their most typical quality or feature.

example.ex: It's a technique that has become the hallmark of Amber Films...
example.tran: 这已经成为安伯电影公司的标志性技术。

example.ex: The killing had the hallmarks of a professional assassination...
example.tran: 这起谋杀案具有职业暗杀的特征。

entry.tran: （金、银、铂制品上标明纯度、产地、制造者的）印记
entry.def: A hallmark is an official mark put on things made of gold, silver, or platinum that indicates the quality of the metal, where the object was made, and who made it.

means.word_mean: 2. a mark on an article of trade to indicate its origin and authenticity

auth_sentence.content: That is the hallmark of the psychopathic maneuver.

sentences.en: The silver vase had been hallmarked at Birmingham.
sentences.cn: 这个银瓶是在伯明翰打上纯度标记的。

sentences.en: The burglary had all the hallmarks of a professional job.
sentences.cn: 从各方面来看,这起入室行窃案都是职业惯犯做的。

sentences.en: Clear expression is the hallmark of good writing.
sentences.cn: 表达清楚是好文章的特点。

sentences.en: One hallmark of a good politician is his ability to influence people.
sentences.cn: 衡量一个优秀政治家的标志之一就是他影响大众的能力。
